# Skip connection

## Special type of connection between layers in neural network which allows the data from previous layers flow to the further layers without being modified

Key concept:
- Leads to better gradient flow on backward pass, as it is easier to compute gradients in large-scale models


Skip-connection is on the right (Identity) - we just sum it with output from weight layer
[![An Introduction to Residual Skip Connections and ResNets - Programmathically](https://programmathically.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Screenshot-2022-01-30-at-08.57.06.png)![An Introduction to Residual Skip Connections and ResNets - Programmathically](data:image/png;base64,)](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&url=https%3A%2F%2Fprogrammathically.com%2Fan-introduction-to-residual-skip-connections-and-resnets%2F&psig=AOvVaw39sXODmcvv9wDz48HKLC9I&ust=1681115348696000&source=images&cd=vfe&ved=0CBEQjRxqFwoTCNiGweuwnP4CFQAAAAAdAAAAABAE)
